benchmark_details.name: HelpSteer-2D
benchmark_details.overview: HelpSteer-2D is a 2-dimensional preference dataset for improving alignment of Large Language Models with human preferences by evaluating responses across multiple aspects and segments.
benchmark_details.data_type: 2-dimensional scores for segment and aspect evaluation

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enable fine-grained alignment of Large Language Models through enhanced preference scoring across segments and aspects.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Performance is only demonstrated on 7B models; it needs more extensive evaluation on larger foundational models.

data.source: Constructed dataset composed of annotated responses with 2-dimensional scores based on segment and aspect breakdowns.
data.annotation: Annotated using a combination of LLMs and human feedback for quality assurance.

methodology.calculation: Utilizes a fine-grained scoring approach across segments and aspect levels in the alignment framework.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores reflect better performance in aligning model outputs with human preferences based on two-dimensional feedback.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against previous methods such as DPO and 1D-DPO, showing improvements across various benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluation on three benchmarks: Arena-Hard, AlpacaEval 2.0, MT-Bench.
